articles.title: Husband speaks out after wife gets coronavirus
articles.description: Kent Frasure and his wife took a cruise on the Diamond Princess-- a ship that is now quarantined with at least 219 confirmed cases of coronavirus, including Kent's wife. Watch "Full Circle" every weeknight at 5 p.m. ET.

articles.author: By Brekke Fletcher, CNN
articles.title: Delta CEO on seat reclining: 'Ask if it's OK first'
articles.description: Delta Air Lines CEO Ed Bastian added a bit of fuel to the great seat recline debate on Friday. In an interview on CNBC, Bastian said that he thinks passenger have a right to recline, but the polite thing to do is "ask if it's OK first."
articles.content:
(CNN) Delta Air Lines CEO Ed Bastian added a bit of fuel to the great seat recline debate that has fired up Twitter.
Appearing on CNBC's "Squawk Box" Friday morning to announce Delta's plans to go carbon neutral, Bastian was pressed to comment on "recline ga… [+2105 chars]

articles.author: Anneken Tappe, CNN Business
articles.title: American consumers stay strong in the face of coronavirus and election uncertainties
articles.description: America's consumers haven't felt this good about the economy in nearly two years despite nascent worries about the global coronavirus outbreak and this year's presidential election.

articles.author: Julia Horowitz, CNN Business
articles.title: Europe's stagnant economy is vulnerable to a shock from China
articles.description: Recession fears are stalking Europe again after Germany's economy flatlined at the end of 2019. The coronavirus now threatens to slam exports to China.

articles.author: Julia Horowitz, CNN Business
articles.title: Germany's economy has flatlined. The coronavirus could push it into recession
articles.description: A version of this story first appeared in CNN Business' Before the Bell newsletter. Not a subscriber? You can sign up right here.

articles.author: Analysis by Laura He, CNN Business
articles.title: Small businesses drive China's economy. The coronavirus outbreak could be fatal for many
articles.description: Small companies that drive China's economic engine are worried about how much damage the novel coronavirus outbreak will cause. Without more help or a reprieve from the disease, many may have only weeks to survive.

articles.author: AJ Willingham, CNN
articles.title: 5 things to know for February 14: Coronavirus, Election 2020, Taliban, White House
articles.description: Here's what else you need to know to Get Up to Speed and Out the Door.
articles.content:

articles.title: Expert: We've seen some 'egregious' misstatements of data
articles.description: Laurie Garrett, an expert on pandemics and author of "Ebola: Story of an Outbreak," spoke to CNN's Bianca Nobilo about what she thinks is behind the spike in novel coronavirus cases in China.

articles.author: Radina Gigova, CNN
articles.title: Russian woman escapes coronavirus quarantine by short-circuiting the lock
articles.description: A Russian woman who escaped a hospital ward where she was under quarantine for novel coronavirus is facing a lawsuit filed by heath authorities for endangering the public, according to Russian state media.
articles.content:
(CNN)A Russian woman who escaped a hospital ward where she was under quarantine for novel coronavirus is facing a lawsuit filed by heath authorities for endangering the public, according to Russian state media.

articles.author: George Ramsay, CNN
articles.title: Tokyo Olympics 'on track' with no contingency plans in place amid coronavirus outbreak
articles.description: The Tokyo 2020 Olympics remain "on track" despite the novel coronavirus outbreak in Asia, a top official said Friday.
articles.content:
(CNN)The Tokyo 2020 Olympics remain "on track" despite the novel coronavirus outbreak in Asia, a top official said Friday.
The virus, which originated in the Chinese city of Wuhan, has infected more than 64,000 people worldwide and claimed 1,383 lives.

articles.title: Global death toll reaches 1,383; China purges officials in Hubei
articles.description: The number of novel coronavirus cases has risen to more than 64,000 worldwide, after China reported another major increase at the epicenter of the outbreak following a change in how authorities there diagnose cases.
articles.content:

articles.title: Quarantined evacuees wrote a petition asking to be tested for coronavirus. Here's why the CDC said no
articles.description: Ordered into quarantine, a group evacuated to California from Wuhan, China, is at odds with the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention and has petitioned for five "critical" changes in their conditions.

articles.title: Hundreds of frontline medics likely infected with coronavirus in China presenting new crisis for the government

articles.author: By Ben Westcott and Adam Renton, CNN
articles.title: Coronavirus cases rise to more than 65,000 globally
articles.description: China's Hubei province on Friday announced 4,823 cases of the virus, under its new broader definition, bringing the global total to more than 65,000.
articles.content:
The Hubei health authority has reported that 116 more people died of the coronavirus in Hubei province on Thursday, bringing the total number of deaths globally to at least 1,486. 
The vast majority of the deaths are in mainland China, with only one death in… [+609 chars]

articles.author: Nectar Gan, Natalie Thomas and David Culver, CNN
articles.title: Hundreds of frontline medics likely infected with coronavirus in China presenting new crisis for the government
articles.description: In Wuhan, the risk faced by medics is exacerbated by a dire shortage of medical resources to cope with the influx of patients, as well as the government's belated warning of the high-infection rate.
